Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Very little of the sherd remains. According to the incline, the sherd belongs in the lower part of the foot, where it is low rising. Such feet are found in the Mature Animal Style, grand Style and Chalice Style. The number 366 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0678) (phase 2)
